Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: chown
Description: Change the user and/or group ownership of a given file, directory, or symbolic link

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: Don't report any failure to change file owner or group, nor modify the exit status to reflect such failures

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: If the file is a symbolic link, change the user ID and/or the group ID of the link itself

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: Interpret user ID and group ID as numeric, avoiding name lookups

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: Cause chown to be verbose, showing files as the owner is modified

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: Change the user ID and/or the group ID for the file hierarchies rooted in the files instead of just the files themselves

Arguments.Name: H
Arguments.Description: If the -R option is specified, symbolic links on the command line are followed

Arguments.Name: L
Arguments.Description: If the -R option is specified, all symbolic links are followed

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: If the -R option is specified, no symbolic links are followed
